project.teaser: The WEnnovate project is a collaborative effort to create new systems and solutions to address urgent complex and systemic challenges. The focus is on the transition to sustainable renewable energy and cross-sector activities in energy and digital innovations, aligned with the...
project.objective:
The WEnnovate project is a collaborative effort to create new systems and solutions to address urgent complex and systemic challenges. The focus is on the transition to sustainable renewable energy and cross-sector activities in energy and digital innovations, aligned with the European Commission's energy directives. The project aims to strengthen the pathways towards Clean Energy for All Europeans and boost Local Energy Communities and Energy Sharing. Social entrepreneurs and professionals play a critical role in developing new solutions to societal problems and environmental challenges, making them important drivers of innovation. The project is divided into two phases: an exploratory phase focusing on social entrepreneurs with deep tech and digital innovations, and a stakeholder engagement phase focusing on engaging stakeholders to gather insights for faster alignment on policy advice and action planning. The project's partners come from Hungary, Slovakia, Ukraine, and the Netherlands, with a complementary role in ensuring the widest possible engagement of dialogue with ecosystem actors and the sound delivery of transitional action plans. The WEnnovate project aims to contribute to the achievement of the Sustainable Development Goals and the strategic objectives of the New European Innovation Agenda.
The project will conduct research and co-design methodology to building partnerships, analysing existing innovation agendas and strategies, identifying areas of competitive advantage for sustainable economic growth, and mapping gaps, needs, and opportunities. The consortium will also enhance synergies and complementarities of their programmes and encourage the alignment of their innovation and related policies impacting innovation in line with the new European Innovation Agenda, as well as creating new frameworks to support ecosystems.
project.title: Co-creating more connected ecosystems to transition European innovation
project.keywords: digital transition, green transition, social transition, innovation, social innovation

article.title: Engaging social entrepreneurs in energy innovative solution development

result.title: D4.1 Stakeholder dialogue framework that includes objective, format and documentation of meetings
result.description: A stakeholder dialogue framework encompasses the predefined objectives, format, and documentation procedures for conducting and capturing the outcomes of stakeholder meetings.

result.title: D5.3 Joint long-term programme plan (incl. Resource and Activity allocation plan)
result.description: "A ""Joint Long-term Program Plan"" encompasses a comprehensive strategy that includes both resource allocation and activity planning over an extended period."

result.title: D4.2 Policy lab to ensure inclusion of deep tech developments in policy making and business decision-making
result.description: "A ""policy lab"" serves as a dedicated platform for guaranteeing the integration of deep tech developments into both policy-making processes and strategic business decision-making."

result.title: D5.2 4 Joint Action plan(s)
result.description: These joint action plans will aim to increase the momentum for alignment in the direction of a combined EU ecosystem and give tools to governments and other stakeholders to steer in one direction. The consortium will research an opportunity to build partnerships with entrepreneurs to develop concrete proposals for digitalisation and deep tech integration in the EU economies. The results of these discussions will be transformed into the format of concrete a joint multi-annual programme and action plans.

result.title: D3.1 4 national deep tech ecosystem maps
result.description: Deep tech ecosystem maps will be created for each national deep tech ecosystem based on research results or research and survey.

result.title: D3.2 Report of needs, problems and obstacles for deep tech development in countries-participants
result.description: Deliverable D3.2 comprises a report detailing the specific needs, challenges, and obstacles encountered in the development of deep tech within the participating countries.

result.title: D5.1 List of recommendations for the action plan with buy-in from the stakeholders’ dialogue
result.description: A list of recommendations for the action plan, which has received approval and support from the stakeholders' dialogue.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - WEnnovate (Co-creating more connected ecosystems to transition European innovation)
result.teaser: The WEnnovate project addresses the ongoing transformation of the EU’s energy system and the essential role that digitalisation must play within this (both requirement and added benefit). The digital energy transition is driven by the need to decarbonise our energy systems...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
